intro: Antidesma kingii, commonly known as the golden antidesma, is a shrub or small tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal forests and dry deciduous forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
